result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle Ann Reid

defendant.name: Reid, Michelle Ann
defendant.address: 4584 S Cty Tk C, Twn Of Superior, WI 54880

records.addlTxt:
08:40 AM Defendant Michelle Ann Reid in court with attorney Fredric B. Anderson.  Defendant Michelle Ann Reid in custody.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement that defendant to plead to sole count in 22CM12. For sole count in 22CM12 pay a $50 fine plus costs and serve 14 days jail with 14 credit, time served. In 22CM21 case dismissed but read in. State has complied with Victim's Rights. Defendant pleads guilty to 22CM12. Attorney Anderson stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights she is waiving by her plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.
Court imposes for 22CM12, pay a $50 fine plus costs and serve 14 days with credit for 14 days, time served. 22CM21 is dismissed but read in.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

01:51 PM Defendant Michelle Ann Reid in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Michelle Ann Reid in custody.  Anne Terrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's address updated and amended on complaint.  Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading, pleas not guilty in both files. Court will accept the pleas of not guilty in both files. Court will set Status Conferences in both files with Judge Glone. Court quashes warrant, questions non appearance. Court does see where there was to be an appearance on the 12th and there was no appearance. Court questions Attorney/Defendant for the non-appearance. Court will quash warrant.  Defendant indicates boyfriend recently deceased and things have been extremely diffcult. State requests on bail: 22CM12 - $500 cash bond with conditions of no contact with Walmart. In 22CM21 - $500 cash with no use or possession of any controlled substances or drug related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Defendant has recently been extradited to Minnesota after failure to appear on an felony escape case. She also has recent failures to appear 5 being in 2021 alone. 
Atty Hoffman questions defendant regarding bail. Defendant is lifelong resident of Douglas County. Defendant is not employed at the moment. Defendant has no money to post any money towards bail. Family is unable to help her. Defendant indicates she is going through screening in St. Louis County for treatment court. Defendant has sentencing coming up on the 16th. 
Court Orders $500 cash bond in 22CM12 with conditions of no contact with Walmart and in 22CM21 - $250 cash bond with conditions of no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Atty Hoffman indicates defendant does quailfy.  Status conference scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
